## webgl package

## Classes

|  Class | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [FBO](./webgl.fbo.md) | WebGL framebuffer wrapper w/ automatic detection &amp; support for multiple render targets (color attachments) and optional depth buffer. Multiple targets are only supported if the <code>WEBGL_draw_buffers</code> extension is available. The max. number of attachments can be obtained via the <code>maxAttachments</code> property of the FBO instance.
```
// create FBO w/ 2 render targets
fbo = new FBO(gl, { tex: [tex1, tex2] });

```
[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WEBGL\_draw\_buffers](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WEBGL_draw_buffers) |
|  [RBO](./webgl.rbo.md) |  |
|  [Shader](./webgl.shader.md) |  |
|  [Texture](./webgl.texture.md) |  |
|  [WebGLArrayBuffer](./webgl.webglarraybuffer.md) |  |
|  [WebGLError](./webgl.webglerror.md) |  |

## Functions

|  Function | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [screen2d(width, height)](./webgl.screen2d.md) | Constructs a orthographic projection matrix for using 2D screen coords, with origin in the top-left corner of the viewport. If a WebGL context is given, the its <code>drawingBufferWidth</code> &amp; <code>drawingBufferHeight</code> values are used. |
|  [screen2d(gl)](./webgl.screen2d_1.md) |  |

## Variables

|  Variable | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [adaptDPI](./webgl.adaptdpi.md) | Sets the canvas size to given <code>width</code> &amp; <code>height</code> and adjusts style to compensate for HDPI devices. Note: For 2D canvases, this will automatically clear any prior canvas content. |
|  [ALIAS\_TEXTURE](./webgl.alias_texture.md) |  |
|  [autoNormalMatrix1](./webgl.autonormalmatrix1.md) | Computes the inverse transpose of given 4x4 matrix uniform, i.e. <code>transpose(invert(m))</code>. |
|  [autoNormalMatrix2](./webgl.autonormalmatrix2.md) | Computes the inverse transpose of the matrix product of given 4x4 matrix uniforms, i.e. <code>transpose(invert(view * model))</code>. |

|  [defTextureCubeMap](./webgl.deftexturecubemap.md) | Creates cube map texture from given 6 <code>face</code> texture sources. The given options are shared by each each side/face of the cube map. The following options are applied to the cube map directly:<!-- -->- <code>filter</code> - <code>mipmap</code>The following options are ignored entirely:<!-- -->- <code>target</code> - <code>image</code> |
|  [defTextureFloat](./webgl.deftexturefloat.md) | Creates &amp; configure a new float texture.<!-- -->\*\*Important:\*\* Since each texel will hold 4x 32-bit float values, the <code>data</code> buffer needs to have a length of at least <code>4 * width * height</code>.<!-- -->Under WebGL 1.0, we assume the caller has previously enabled the <code>OES_texture_float</code> extension. |
|  [draw](./webgl.draw.md) |  |
|  [error](./webgl.error.md) |  |
|  [EXPORT\_FRAGCOL](./webgl.export_fragcol.md) | GLSL version specific fragment shader output. If <code>__VERSION__ &gt;= 300</code> assigns <code>body</code> to <code>out</code>, else to <code>gl_FragColor</code>. |
